entries.title: US: First post-Roe March for Life pushes Congress for federal abortion limits
entries.description: Tens of thousands of anti-abortion protestors marched toward the Capitol, in Washington, DC, on Friday. Joe Biden offered his counterpoint in a proclamation recognizing Sunday, January 22, as the 50th anniversary of Roe v. Wade.

entries.title: French Parti Socialiste announces reelection of First Secretary Olivier Faure amid confusion
entries.description: Once again unable to conduct a peaceful internal democracy procedure, the Parti Socialiste has announced the reappointment of Olivier Faure as first secretary despite accusations of irregularities by his opponent Nicolas Mayer-Rossignol.

entries.title: Elon Musk on the stand for two 2018 tweets about Tesla
entries.description: The billionaire suggested that he had 'funding secured' to take the company private and that a deal was imminent. It resulted in a $40 million settlement with securities regulators and a class-action lawsuit alleging he misled investors.

entries.title: Chris Hipkins set to become New Zealand's next prime minister
entries.description: Education Minister Chris Hipkins was the only candidate to enter the contest Saturday to replace Jacinda Ardern .

entries.title: Brazil's Dani Alves jailed on remand in Spain over sexual assault allegation
entries.description: A Spanish judge on Friday ordered that the football player be jailed on remand without bail over an alleged sexual assault of a woman in a Barcelona nightclub.

entries.title: Washington designates Russia's Wagner 'criminal organization'
entries.description: The designation will allow wider application of sanctions on the group's sprawling global network.

entries.title: Feminist activists and historians are rehabilitating Scotland's 'witches'
entries.description: Between 1563 and 1727, over 2,500 people, most of them women, were accused of witchcraft and executed in Scotland. Historians, organizations and the government are now working to condemn these injust sentences.

entries.title: British PM Sunak fined for not wearing seat belt
entries.description: British police issued Prime Minister Rishi Sunak with a fine on Friday for traveling in the backseat of a car without wearing his seat belt while filming a social media clip.

entries.title: Anti-French protesters rally in Ouagadougou
entries.description: Demonstrators called for the French ambassador to Burkina Faso to leave the country and demand the closure of a military base.

entries.title: Pension reform: First day of protest emboldens unions
entries.description: France's eight main trade unions and five youth movements are now trying to keep the protest movement going.

entries.title: Ukraine allies fail to reach agreement on tanks
entries.description: Western defense officials convened in Ramstein, Germany, on Friday, January 20, could not overcome divisions over providing advanced battle tanks to Ukraine.

entries.title: Less pollinating insects mean more deaths every year
entries.description: Researchers at Harvard University believe around 500,000 die every year as a direct consequence of failing pollination.

entries.title: Turkish President Erdogan is vying to run for a third term
entries.description: By bringing forward the date of the election by one month, the Turkish leader wants to circumvent an article in the Constitution stating that a person can only be elected president a maximum of two times.

entries.title: Uncovering the not-so-simple story behind de Gaulle's mythic Appeal of June 18
entries.description: No recording has been preserved of one of the most celebrated speeches in French history. What remains is a legend, which 'Le Monde,' in partnership with Ircam, has attempted to reconstruct by cloning de Gaulle's radio voice.

entries.title: Romanian government faces series of plagiarism cases
entries.description: Interior Minister Lucian Bode is the country's fourth cabinet member accused of academic fraud.

entries.title: Leading Rwandan journalist killed in road accident
entries.description: John Williams Ntwali regularly produced content that was critical of the government, despite the country's tightly controlled media.

entries.title: German lawmakers recognize Yazidi genocide in Iraq
entries.description: The Bundestag called on Thursday for a series of measures aimed at better protecting the minority.

entries.title: Jacinda Ardern's surprise resignation: The art of doing politics differently
entries.description: Unprecedented in recent political history, where the art of knowing how to retire is rare, the departure of the New Zealand PM illustrates her mastery of the codes of communication.

entries.title: Macron presents significant increase in military spending until 2030
entries.description: The French President's new military budget addresses both for the impact of the war in Ukraine and the need to strengthen domestic security.

entries.title: Twelve years after Tunisian president's fall, French authorities are still hunting for Ben Ali's family fortune
entries.description: In the investigation of 'ill-gotten gains,' prosecutors have discovered several luxury apartments but are struggling to trace the funds used for the purchases.

entries.title: Google cuts 12,000 jobs as tech industry layoffs widen
entries.description: Microsoft, Amazon and Meta have also announced cuts in recent weeks, with the sector in an economic downturn.

entries.title: European countries increase their military aid to Ukraine
entries.description: Denmark made the unexpected announcement on Thursday that it will donate all of its 19 CAESAR self-propelled howitzers, and more support is expected, notably from the US.

entries.title: Pension reform: French unions fire a successful warning shot
entries.description: With a strong mobilization across France and many employees from the private sector engaging in the protests, the first day of action against the pension reform shows that the middle classes are on the alert.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Zelensky urges allies to 'speed up' weapon deliveries
entries.description: The Ukrainian president was addressing defense leaders who are gathered at Ramstein Air Base in Germany on Friday to decide whether tanks will be supplied to Ukraine.

entries.title: Pension reform: Confronted by giant protests, Macron reaffirms determination to 'push ahead'
entries.description: Speaking from Spain as over one million people demonstrated across France, the president framed the debate in terms of his own electoral mandate.

entries.title: Western tanks in the war in Ukraine: An overview of their role and tactical utility
entries.description: Vehicles such as the Leclerc, the Leopard 2 and the AMX-10 RC are the subject of a coordination meeting between Western allies on supplying equipment to Ukraine.

entries.title: In Burkina Faso, the unprecedented kidnapping of fifty women
entries.description: Jihadist abductions of civilians are increasing, while 40% of the territory is outside of state control. One million people live in blockaded areas, according to the UN.

entries.title: Nicaragua: Two French women found guilty of 'conspiracy against the nation'
entries.description: In the midst of a repressive spiral, the prosecutor's office requested eight years in prison for two French women close to a political opponent of President Daniel Ortega.

entries.title: Media: RT France's days are numbered
entries.description: The Russian channel's bank account has been blocked as a result of the ninth package of European sanctions decided in December. Its survival in the short term seems very unlikely.

entries.title: Didier Lestrade, co-founder of Act Up-Paris: 'We could really solve the AIDS problem once and for all'
entries.description: Forty years after the discovery of HIV, Didier Lestrade, a pioneer of the fight against AIDS in France, looks back on the darkest years of the epidemic. He regrets the lack of interest it arouses today among part of society.

entries.title: French pension reform: Making pensioners contribute is the big taboo
entries.description: Some economists are calling for the highest pensions to be taxed, but the government is rejecting this option.

entries.title: Pension reform: 1.12 million demonstrators protest across France on the first day of mobilization
entries.description: Trade unions successfully organized strong protests throughout France against extending the retirement age to 64. The next day of action is scheduled for January 31.

entries.title: Folk-rock pioneer David Crosby dies at 81
entries.description: The trailblazing singer-songwriter whose time with The Byrds and later Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young expanded rock's range, has died, his publicist said Thursday. The two-time Rock and Roll Hall of Famer remained a prolific artist throughout his life.

entries.title: NBA Paris Game 2023: Bulls defeat Pistons 126-108
entries.description: Player Zach LaVine – who said his great-grandfather was French – scored 30 points and the Chicago Bulls never trailed in a 126-108 win over the Detroit Pistons at the NBA Paris Game on Thursday.
